understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method named getStreamingKeepAlivePeriod() which returns a value from a configuration variable conf.streaming_keep_alive_period_in_secs.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration setting for the keep-alive period for streaming. The method retrieves the value from the configuration variable to determine the period at which keep-alive messages are sent during streaming.

config_description: Set keep-alive period for streaming This node will send a keep-alive message periodically with this period. If the node does not receive a keep-alive message from the peer for 2 keep-alive cycles the stream session times out and fail Default value is 300s (5 minutes), which means stalled stream times out in 10 minutes by default
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'streaming_keep_alive_period_in_secs' is used to set the keep-alive period for streaming. This means that the node will send a keep-alive message periodically with the specified period to maintain the connection with the peer.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever a keep-alive task is scheduled for a channel. This happens when a new stream session is established or when an existing session needs to be maintained.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'streaming_keep_alive_period_in_secs' configuration option is significant as it directly affects the stability and reliability of the streaming sessions. A shorter period may result in more frequent keep-alive messages being sent, increasing network traffic but ensuring quicker detection of stalled streams. On the other hand, a longer period may reduce network overhead but increase the risk of session timeouts and failures.
